content: 1 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus､ Through the will of God,— According to the promise of life in Christ Jesus;—
content_old: 1 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus､ Through the will of God,— According to the promise of life in Christ Jesus;—

content: 2 Unto Timothy､ my beloved child: Favour､ mercy､ peace, from God our Father､ and Christ Jesus our Lord.
content_old: 2 Unto Timothy､ my beloved child: Favour､ mercy､ peace, from God our Father､ and Christ Jesus our Lord.

content: 3 Grateful am I､ unto God,— Unto whom I am rendering divine service from my progenitors in a pure conscience That incessant hold I the remembrance concerning thee in my supplications; Day and night
content_old: 3 Grateful am I､ unto God,— Unto whom I am rendering divine service from my progenitors in a pure conscience That incessant hold I the remembrance concerning thee in my supplications; Day and night

content: 4 longing to see thee, Being mindful of thy tears,— In order that with joy I may be filled:
content_old: 4 longing to see thee, Being mindful of thy tears,— In order that with joy I may be filled:

content: 5 A reminder having received､ of the unfeigned faith that is in thee,—Such as dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois､ and in thy mother Eunicè,—I am persuaded､ moreover､ that it dwelleth in thee also.
content_old: 5 A reminder having received､ of the unfeigned faith that is in thee,—Such as dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois､ and in thy mother Eunicè,—I am persuaded､ moreover､ that it dwelleth in thee also.

content: 6 For which cause I put thee in remembrance､ to be stirring up God’s gift of favour, Which is in thee through means of the laying on of my hands;
content_old: 6 For which cause I put thee in remembrance､ to be stirring up God’s gift of favour, Which is in thee through means of the laying on of my hands;

content: 7 For God hath not given us a spirit of cowardice, But of power､ and love､ and correction.
content_old: 7 For God hath not given us a spirit of cowardice, But of power､ and love､ and correction.

content: 8 Be not thou､ therefore､ put to shame— With regard to the witness of our Lord, Nor with regard to me his prisoner; But suffer hardship together with the glad-message､ according to the power of God,—
content_old: 8 Be not thou､ therefore､ put to shame— With regard to the witness of our Lord, Nor with regard to me his prisoner; But suffer hardship together with the glad-message､ according to the power of God,—

content: 9 Who hath saved us､ and called us with a holy calling, Not according to our works､ But according to the peculiar purpose and favour— Which was given to us in Christ Jesus before age-during times､
content_old: 9 Who hath saved us､ and called us with a holy calling, Not according to our works､ But according to the peculiar purpose and favour— Which was given to us in Christ Jesus before age-during times､

content: 10 But hath now been made manifest through means of the forthshining of our Saviour Christ Jesus,— Who､ indeed､ hath abolished death, And hath thrown light upon life and incorruptibility､ through means of the glad-message:
content_old: 10 But hath now been made manifest through means of the forthshining of our Saviour Christ Jesus,— Who､ indeed､ hath abolished death, And hath thrown light upon life and incorruptibility､ through means of the glad-message:

content: 11 Whereunto I have been appointed herald and apostle and teacher;—
content_old: 11 Whereunto I have been appointed herald and apostle and teacher;—

content: 12 For which cause these things also am I suffering; Nevertheless I am not being put to shame, For I know him whom I have believed, And am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have entrusted to him unto that day.
content_old: 12 For which cause these things also am I suffering; Nevertheless I am not being put to shame, For I know him whom I have believed, And am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have entrusted to him unto that day.

content: 13 An outline have thou, of healthful discourses which from me thou hast heard—With the faith and love which are in Christ Jesus:
content_old: 13 An outline have thou, of healthful discourses which from me thou hast heard—With the faith and love which are in Christ Jesus:

content: 14 The noble thing entrusted to thee do thou guard､ Through means of the Holy Spirit which dwelleth within us.
content_old: 14 The noble thing entrusted to thee do thou guard､ Through means of the Holy Spirit which dwelleth within us.

content: 15 Thou knowest this— That all they who are in Asia have turned away from me,— Of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.
content_old: 15 Thou knowest this— That all they who are in Asia have turned away from me,— Of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.

content: 16 The Lord grant mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus, In that ofttimes hath he refreshed me, And as regardeth my chain hath not been put to shame､
content_old: 16 The Lord grant mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus, In that ofttimes hath he refreshed me, And as regardeth my chain hath not been put to shame､

content: 17 But happening to be in Rome he diligently sought out and found me,—
content_old: 17 But happening to be in Rome he diligently sought out and found me,—

content: 1 Thou therefore､ my child, be empowering thyself in the favour that is in Christ Jesus,
content_old: 1 Thou therefore､ my child, be empowering thyself in the favour that is in Christ Jesus,

content: 2 And the things which thou hast heard from me among many witnesses The same entrust thou unto faithful men, Such as shall be competent to teach others also.
content_old: 2 And the things which thou hast heard from me among many witnesses The same entrust thou unto faithful men, Such as shall be competent to teach others also.

content: 3 Take thy part in suffering hardship､ as a brave soldier of Christ Jesus:—
content_old: 3 Take thy part in suffering hardship､ as a brave soldier of Christ Jesus:—

content: 4 No one that is serving as a soldier entangleth himself with the matters of his livelihood, That he may please him that hath summoned him to serve as a soldier;
content_old: 4 No one that is serving as a soldier entangleth himself with the matters of his livelihood, That he may please him that hath summoned him to serve as a soldier;

content: 5 If､ moreover､ any man contend even in the games He is not crowned､ unless lawfully he contend;
content_old: 5 If､ moreover､ any man contend even in the games He is not crowned､ unless lawfully he contend;

content: 6 The toiling husbandman ought first of the fruits to partake:
content_old: 6 The toiling husbandman ought first of the fruits to partake:

content: 7 Think､ as to what I am speaking; For the Lord will give thee discernment in all things.
content_old: 7 Think､ as to what I am speaking; For the Lord will give thee discernment in all things.

content: 8 Keep in mind Jesus Christ— Raised from among the dead, Of the seed of David,— According to my joyful message:
content_old: 8 Keep in mind Jesus Christ— Raised from among the dead, Of the seed of David,— According to my joyful message:

content: 9 In which I am suffering hardship､ Even unto bonds､ As an evil-doer; But the word of God is not bound.
content_old: 9 In which I am suffering hardship､ Even unto bonds､ As an evil-doer; But the word of God is not bound.

content: 10 For this cause am I enduring all things for the sake of the chosen, In order that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus along with glory age-abiding.
content_old: 10 For this cause am I enduring all things for the sake of the chosen, In order that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus along with glory age-abiding.

content: 11 Faithful the saying—For If we have died together we shall also live together,
content_old: 11 Faithful the saying—For If we have died together we shall also live together,

content: 12 If we endure we shall also reign together; If we shall deny he also will deny us,
content_old: 12 If we endure we shall also reign together; If we shall deny he also will deny us,

content: 13 If we are faithless he faithful abideth,— For deny himself he cannot!
content_old: 13 If we are faithless he faithful abideth,— For deny himself he cannot!

content: 14 Of these things be putting them in remembrance, Adjuring them before God Not to be waging word-battles,— Useful for nothing, Occasioning a subversion of them that hearken.
content_old: 14 Of these things be putting them in remembrance, Adjuring them before God Not to be waging word-battles,— Useful for nothing, Occasioning a subversion of them that hearken.

content: 15 Give diligence thyself､ approved to present unto God,— A workman not to be put to shame, Skilfully handling the word of truth.
content_old: 15 Give diligence thyself､ approved to present unto God,— A workman not to be put to shame, Skilfully handling the word of truth.

content: 16 But the profane pratings shun; For unto more ungodliness will they force themselves on;
content_old: 16 But the profane pratings shun; For unto more ungodliness will they force themselves on;

content: 17 And their discourse､ as a gangrene will eat its way;— Of whom are Hymenæus and Philetus,
content_old: 17 And their discourse､ as a gangrene will eat its way;— Of whom are Hymenæus and Philetus,

content: 18 Men who concerning the truth have erred､ Affirming a resurrection､ already to have taken place, And are overthrowing the faith of some.
content_old: 18 Men who concerning the truth have erred､ Affirming a resurrection､ already to have taken place, And are overthrowing the faith of some.

content: 19 Howbeit the firm foundation of God standeth, Having this seal— The Lord hath acknowledged them who are his, And Let every one that nameth the name of the Lord stand aloof from unrighteousness.
content_old: 19 Howbeit the firm foundation of God standeth, Having this seal— The Lord hath acknowledged them who are his, And Let every one that nameth the name of the Lord stand aloof from unrighteousness.

content: 20 But in a great house there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also wooden and earthen: And some indeed､ for honour, While some are for dishonour:
content_old: 20 But in a great house there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also wooden and earthen: And some indeed､ for honour, While some are for dishonour:

content: 21 If､ therefore､ anyone will､ for pureness､ sever himself from these He shall be a vessel for honour, hallowed, meet for the Master’s use, for every good work prepared.
content_old: 21 If､ therefore､ anyone will､ for pureness､ sever himself from these He shall be a vessel for honour, hallowed, meet for the Master’s use, for every good work prepared.

content: 22 But from the youthful covetings flee! And pursue righteousness､ faith､ love､ peace, Along with them who call upon the Lord out of a pure heart.
content_old: 22 But from the youthful covetings flee! And pursue righteousness､ faith､ love､ peace, Along with them who call upon the Lord out of a pure heart.

content: 23 But from the foolish and undisciplined questionings excuse thyself, Knowing that they gender strifes;
content_old: 23 But from the foolish and undisciplined questionings excuse thyself, Knowing that they gender strifes;

content: 24 And a servant of the Lord ought not to strive, But to be gentle towards all､ apt in teaching､ ready to endure malice,—
content_old: 24 And a servant of the Lord ought not to strive, But to be gentle towards all､ apt in teaching､ ready to endure malice,—

content: 25 In meekness bringing under discipline them that oppose themselves, Lest at any time God should give them repentance unto a personal knowledge of truth,
content_old: 25 In meekness bringing under discipline them that oppose themselves, Lest at any time God should give them repentance unto a personal knowledge of truth,

content: 1 But of this be taking note— That in last days there will set in perilous seasons;
content_old: 1 But of this be taking note— That in last days there will set in perilous seasons;

content: 2 For men will be—fond of themselves､ fond of money､ ostentatious､ arrogant､ defamers､ to parents unyielding､ unthankful､ unkind､
content_old: 2 For men will be—fond of themselves､ fond of money､ ostentatious､ arrogant､ defamers､ to parents unyielding､ unthankful､ unkind､

content: 3 without natural affection､ accepting no truce､ given to intrigue､ without self-control､ uncivilised､ unfriendly to good men,
content_old: 3 without natural affection､ accepting no truce､ given to intrigue､ without self-control､ uncivilised､ unfriendly to good men,

content: 4 traitors､ reckless､ beclouded, lovers of pleasure more than lovers of God,
content_old: 4 traitors､ reckless､ beclouded, lovers of pleasure more than lovers of God,

content: 5 having a form of godliness､ but the power thereof denying! And from these turn away;
content_old: 5 having a form of godliness､ but the power thereof denying! And from these turn away;

content: 6 For of these are they who enter into the houses, And captivate silly women､ women laden with sins､ led on by manifold covetings,
content_old: 6 For of these are they who enter into the houses, And captivate silly women､ women laden with sins､ led on by manifold covetings,

content: 7 Ever learning and never unto a personal knowledge of truth able to come;
content_old: 7 Ever learning and never unto a personal knowledge of truth able to come;

content: 8 Moreover like as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses So､ these men also withstand the truth,— Men utterly corrupted in their mind, Disapproved concerning their faith;
content_old: 8 Moreover like as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses So､ these men also withstand the truth,— Men utterly corrupted in their mind, Disapproved concerning their faith;

content: 9 But they shall not force their way further, For their folly shall be fully evident unto all,— As also that of those men became.
content_old: 9 But they shall not force their way further, For their folly shall be fully evident unto all,— As also that of those men became.

content: 10 But thou hast closely studied— My teaching､ manner of life､ purpose､ faith､ long-suffering､ love､ endurance､
content_old: 10 But thou hast closely studied— My teaching､ manner of life､ purpose､ faith､ long-suffering､ love､ endurance､

content: 11 persecutions､ sufferings, What manner of things befel me at Antioch､ at Iconium､ at Lystra, What manner of persecutions I endured,— And out of all the Lord rescued me;—
content_old: 11 persecutions､ sufferings, What manner of things befel me at Antioch､ at Iconium､ at Lystra, What manner of persecutions I endured,— And out of all the Lord rescued me;—

content: 12 Yea and all who are determined to live in a godly manner in Christ Jesus will be persecuted;
content_old: 12 Yea and all who are determined to live in a godly manner in Christ Jesus will be persecuted;

content: 13 Whereas wicked men and howling impostors will force their way to the worse, Deceiving and being deceived.
content_old: 13 Whereas wicked men and howling impostors will force their way to the worse, Deceiving and being deceived.

content: 14 But thou—abide in the things which thou hast learned､ and been entrusted with, Knowing from whom thou hast learned them,—
content_old: 14 But thou—abide in the things which thou hast learned､ and been entrusted with, Knowing from whom thou hast learned them,—

content: 15 And that from a babe those sacred letters thou hast known which are able to make thee wise unto salvation､ Through the faith which is in Christ Jesus:
content_old: 15 And that from a babe those sacred letters thou hast known which are able to make thee wise unto salvation､ Through the faith which is in Christ Jesus:

content: 16 Every scripture is God-breathed､ And profitable���unto teaching､ unto conviction､ unto correction､ unto the discipline that is in righteousness,—
content_old: 16 Every scripture is God-breathed､ And profitable���unto teaching､ unto conviction､ unto correction､ unto the discipline that is in righteousness,—

content: 1 I adjure thee before God, and Christ Jesus— Who is about to be judging living and dead,— Both as to his forthshining and his kingdom
content_old: 1 I adjure thee before God, and Christ Jesus— Who is about to be judging living and dead,— Both as to his forthshining and his kingdom

content: 2 Proclaim the word, Take thy position—in season､ out of season､— Convince､ rebuke､ encourage､— With all long-suffering and teaching.
content_old: 2 Proclaim the word, Take thy position—in season､ out of season､— Convince､ rebuke､ encourage､— With all long-suffering and teaching.

content: 3 For there will be a season— When the healthful teaching they will not endure, But according to their own covetings will unto themselves heap up teachers､ Because they have an itching ear,
content_old: 3 For there will be a season— When the healthful teaching they will not endure, But according to their own covetings will unto themselves heap up teachers､ Because they have an itching ear,

content: 4 And from the truth indeed､ their ear will they turn away､ While unto stories they will turn themselves aside.
content_old: 4 And from the truth indeed､ their ear will they turn away､ While unto stories they will turn themselves aside.

content: 5 But thoul—be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, thy ministry completely fulfil;
content_old: 5 But thoul—be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, thy ministry completely fulfil;

content: 6 For I already am being poured out as a drink-offering, And the season of my release is at hand,—
content_old: 6 For I already am being poured out as a drink-offering, And the season of my release is at hand,—

content: 7 The noble contest have I contested, The race have I finished, The faith have I kept:
content_old: 7 The noble contest have I contested, The race have I finished, The faith have I kept:

content: 8 Henceforth lieth by for me— The crown of righteousness, Which the Lord will render unto me in that day,— The righteous judge,— Yet not alone unto me, But unto all them also who have loved his forthshining.
content_old: 8 Henceforth lieth by for me— The crown of righteousness, Which the Lord will render unto me in that day,— The righteous judge,— Yet not alone unto me, But unto all them also who have loved his forthshining.

content: 9 Give diligence to come unto me speedily,
content_old: 9 Give diligence to come unto me speedily,

content: 10 For Demas hath forsaken me､ having loved the present age､ And hath journeyed untoThessalonica; Crescens unto Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia:
content_old: 10 For Demas hath forsaken me､ having loved the present age､ And hath journeyed untoThessalonica; Crescens unto Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia:

content: 11 Luke alone is with me. Receiving Mark back bring him with thyself, For he is very useful to me for ministering;
content_old: 11 Luke alone is with me. Receiving Mark back bring him with thyself, For he is very useful to me for ministering;

content: 12 and Tychicus have I sent unto Ephesus.
content_old: 12 and Tychicus have I sent unto Ephesus.

content: 13 The cloak that I left in Troas､ with Carpus when thou comest bring; And the scrolls, especially the parchments.
content_old: 13 The cloak that I left in Troas､ with Carpus when thou comest bring; And the scrolls, especially the parchments.

content: 14 Alexander the coppersmith of much baseness towards me hath given proof,— The Lord will render unto him according to his works.—
content_old: 14 Alexander the coppersmith of much baseness towards me hath given proof,— The Lord will render unto him according to his works.—

content: 15 Of whom be thou also on thy guard, For he hath greatly withstood our words.
content_old: 15 Of whom be thou also on thy guard, For he hath greatly withstood our words.

content: 16 In my first defence no man came in to help me, but all forsook me,—Unto them may it not be reckoned!—
content_old: 16 In my first defence no man came in to help me, but all forsook me,—Unto them may it not be reckoned!—

content: 17 But the Lord stood by me､ and empowered me, In order that through me the proclamation might be fully made, and all the nations might hear; And I was delivered out of the mouth of a lion:—
content_old: 17 But the Lord stood by me､ and empowered me, In order that through me the proclamation might be fully made, and all the nations might hear; And I was delivered out of the mouth of a lion:—

content: 18 The Lord will rescue me from every wicked work, And will bring me safe into his heavenly kingdom: Unto whom be the glory､ unto the ages of ages. Amen.
content_old: 18 The Lord will rescue me from every wicked work, And will bring me safe into his heavenly kingdom: Unto whom be the glory､ unto the ages of ages. Amen.

content: 19 Salute Prisca and Aquila and the house of Onesiphorus.
content_old: 19 Salute Prisca and Aquila and the house of Onesiphorus.

content: 20 Erastus remained in Corinth; but Trophimus I left at Miletus､ sick.
content_old: 20 Erastus remained in Corinth; but Trophimus I left at Miletus､ sick.

content: 21 Give diligence to come before winter. There salute thee—Eubulus､ and Pudens､ and Linus､ and Claudia, and all the brethren.
content_old: 21 Give diligence to come before winter. There salute thee—Eubulus､ and Pudens､ and Linus､ and Claudia, and all the brethren.
